page.title: 09My Club-Guides
page.content: Guides meet at the Parish Hall. We meet on a Wednesday at seven. Any girl can join but has to be over eleven. When enrolled we wear a uniform, which is a royal blue blouse, navy skirt and hat. Each troop wears a different coloured necker and is divided into patrols. When we meet we get out our patrol boxes which contain such things as a ball, books, puzzles, paper, pencils and crayons. Each evening we talk together with our leader and learn things such as campcraft, and we work towards our proficiency badges. We also play games. I enjoy guides because it is something different to do and in the summer we can go to camp. Each meeting lasts for two hours, and we pay a monthly subscription of fifty pence. At the end of guides we say a prayer and then go home.
